record.name: Envelope
record.desc: Contains internal IPTC data used formerly in telecommunications. Now it is considered being deprecated and is not widely in use.

tag.name: ModelVersion
tag.desc: A number identifying the version of the Information Interchange Model, Part I, utilised by the provider. Version numbers are assigned by IPTC and NAA. The version number of this record is four (4).

tag.name: Destination
tag.desc: This DataSet is to accommodate some providers who require routing information above the appropriate OSI layers.

tag.name: FileFormat
tag.desc: A number representing the file format. The file format must be registered with IPTC or NAA with a unique number assigned to it (see Appendix A). The information is used to route the data to the appropriate system and to allow the receiving system to perform the appropriate actions thereto.

enum.name: FileFormats
enum.desc: Registered file formats by IPTC and NAA

item.name: TIFF
item.desc: Tagged Image File Format (Adobe/Aldus Image data) (Recommended for image ObjectData Preview)

item.name: UCOFF
item.desc: IPTC Unstructured Character Oriented File Format (UCOFF)
item.human-name: IPTC Unstructured Character Oriented File Format

item.name: JPEG
item.desc: ¤ JPEG File Interchange (JFIF) (Recommended for image ObjectData Preview)

item.name: BMP
item.desc: ¤ Microsoft Bit Mapped Graphics File [*.BMP] (Recommended for image ObjectData Preview)

item.name: AIFF
item.desc: Audio Interchange File Format AIFF (Apple Computer Inc)

tag.name: FileFormatVersion
tag.desc: A binary number representing the particular version of the <see cref='FileFormat'/>

enum.name: FileFormatVersions
enum.desc: File formta version registered for NAA and IPTC

item.name: V1
item.desc: Version 1 for file fromat <see cref="FileFormats.NewsphotoParameterRecord"/> and <see cref="FileFormats.NAA89_3"/>, 5.0 for <see cref="FileFormats.TIFF"/>, 1.40 for <see cref="FileFormats.AdobeIllustrator"/>, 2 for <see cref="FileFormats.AppleSingle"/>, 1.02 for <see cref="FileFormats.JPEG"/> and 3.1 for <see cref="FileFormats.Freehand"/>
item.human-name: 1 (IPTC-NAA Digital Newsphoto Parameter Record, NAA 89-3), 5.0 (TIFF), 1.40 (Adobe Illustrator), 2 (Apple Single), 1.02 (JPEG), 3.1 (Freehand)

item.name: V2
item.desc: Version 2 for file format <see cref="FileFormats.NewsphotoParameterRecord"/>, 6.0 for <see cref="FileFormats.TIFF"/>, 4.0 for <see cref="FileFormats.Freehand"/> and 2.0 for <see cref="FileFormats.HTML"/>

item.name: V3
item.desc: Version 3 for file format <see cref="FileFormats.NewsphotoparameterRecord"/> and 5.0 for <see cref="FileFormats.Freehand"/>

item.name: V4
item.desc: Version 4 for file format <see cref="FileFormats.NewsphotoparameterRecord"/> and <see cref="FileFormats.RecomendedMessageFormat"/> and 5.5 for <see cref="FileFormats.Freehand"/>
item.human-name: 4 (IPTC-NAA Digital Newsphoto Parameter Record, Recomended Message Format), 5.5 (Freehand)

tag.name: ServiceIdentifier
tag.desc: Identifies the provider and product.

tag.name: EnvelopeNumber
tag.desc: The characters form a number that will be unique for the date specified in <see cref='DateSent'/> and for the Service Identifier specified in <see cref='ServiceIdentifier'/>. If identical envelope numbers appear with the same date and with the same Service Identifier, records 2-9 must be unchanged from the original. This is not intended to be a sequential serial number reception check.

tag.name: ProductID
tag.desc: Allows a provider to identify subsets of its overall service. Used to provide receiving organisation data on which to select, route, or otherwise handle data.

tag.name: EnvelopePriority
tag.desc: Specifies the envelope handling priority and not the editorial urgency (see 2:10, <see cref='Urgency'/>). '1' indicates the most urgent, '5' the normal urgency, and '8' the least urgent copy. The numeral '9' indicates a User Defined Priority. The numeral '0' is reserved for future use.

tag.name: DateSent
tag.desc: Indicates year, month and day the service sent the material.

tag.name: TimeSent
tag.desc: This is the time the service sent the material.

tag.name: CodedCharacterSet
tag.desc: <para>Array of bytes consisting of one or more control functions used for the announcement, invocation or designation of coded character sets. The control functions follow the ISO 2022 standard and may consist of the escape control character and one or more graphic characters. For more details see Appendix C, the IPTC-NAA Code Library.</para> <para>The control functions apply to character oriented DataSets in records 2-6. They also apply to record 8, unless the objectdata explicitly, or the File Format implicitly, defines character sets otherwise.</para> <para>If this DataSet contains the designation function for Unicode in UTF-8 then no other announcement, designation or invocation functions are permitted in this DataSet or in records 2-6. For all other character sets, one or more escape sequences are used:<para/> <list> <item>for the announcement of the code extension facilities used in the data which follows,</item> <item>for the initial designation of the G0, G1, G2 and G3 graphic character sets and</item> <item>for the initial invocation of the graphic set (7 bits) or the lefthand and the right-hand graphic set (8 bits) and for the initial invocation of the C0 (7 bits) or of the C0 and the C1 control character sets (8 bits).</item></list> <para>The announcement of the code extension facilities, if transmitted, must appear in this data set. Designation and invocation of graphic and control function sets (shifting) may be transmitted anywhere where the escape and the other necessary control characters are permitted. However, it is recommended to transmit in this DataSet an initial designation and invocation, i.e. to define all designations and the shift status currently in use by transmitting the appropriate escape sequences and locking-shift functions.</para> <para>If <see cref='CodedCharacterSet'/> is omitted, the default for records 2-6 and 8 is ISO 646 IRV (7 bits) or ISO 4873 DV (8 bits). Record 1 shall always use ISO 646 IRV or ISO 4873 DV respectively.</para>

tag.name: UNO
tag.desc: UNO Unique Name of Object, providing eternal, globally unique identification for objects as specified in the IIM, independent of provider and for any media form. The provider must ensure the UNO is unique. Objects with the same UNO are identical.

tag.name: ARMIdentifier
tag.desc: The DataSet identifies the Abstract Relationship Method (ARM) which is described in a document registered by the originator of the ARM with the IPTC and NAA.

tag.name: ARMVersion
tag.desc: A number representing the particular version of the ARM specified in DataSet <see cref='ARMIdentified'/>.

item.name: IPTCMethod1
item.desc: Using DataSets 2:45, 2:47 and 2:50 (<see cref='ReferenceService'/>, <see cref='ReferenceDate'/> and <see cref='ReferenceNumber'/>)

record.name: Application
record.desc: This record contain informative data about content. Whole record is optional, but when any tag is used then mandatory tags are mandatory.

tag.name: RecordVersion
tag.desc: A number identifying the version of the Information Interchange Model, Part II (Record 2:xx), utilised by the provider. Version numbers are assigned by IPTC and NAA. The version number of this record is four (4).

tag.name: ObjectTypeReference
tag.desc: The Object Type is used to distinguish between different types of objects within the IIM. The first part is a number representing a language independent international reference to an Object Type followed by a colon separator. The second part, if used, is a text representation of the Object Type Number (maximum 64 octets) consisting of graphic characters plus spaces either in English, as defined in Appendix G, or in the language of the service as indicated in DataSet 2:135 (<see='LanguageIdentifier'/>)

enum.name: ObjectTypes
enum.desc: Object Type Number and Object Type Name relationship

item.name: Data
item.desc: Data. Data in this context implies typically non narrative information, usually not eligible for journalistic intervention or modification. It also applies to information routed by the provider from a third party to the user. Examples are sports results, stock prices and agate.

tag.name: ObjectAttributeReference
tag.desc: The Object Attribute defines the nature of the object independent of the Subject. The first part is a number representing a language independent international reference to an Object Attribute followed by a colon separator. The second part, if used, is a text representation of the Object Attribute Number ( maximum 64 octets) consisting of graphic characters plus spaces either in English, as defined in Appendix G, or in the language of the service as indicated in DataSet 2:135 (<see='LanguageIdentifier'/>)

enum.name: ObjectAttributes
enum.desc: Object Attribute Number abd Object Name relationship

tag.name: EditStatus
tag.desc: Status of the objectdata, according to the practice of the provider.

tag.name: EditorialUpdate
tag.desc: Indicates the type of update that this object provides to a previous object. The link to the previous object is made using the ARM (DataSets 1:120 and 1:122 (<see cref='ARM'/>)), according to the practices of the provider.

item.name: AdditionalLanguage
item.desc: Additional language. Signifies that the accompanying Record 2 DataSets repeat information from another object in a different natural language (as indicated by DataSet 2:135 - <see cref='LanguageIdentifier'/>).

tag.name: Urgency
tag.desc: Specifies the editorial urgency of content and not necessarily the envelope handling priority (see 1:60, Envelope Priority). The '1' is most urgent, '5' normal and '8' denotes the least-urgent copy. The numerals '9' and '0' are reserved for future use.

tag.name: SubjectReference
tag.desc: The Subject Reference is a structured definition of the subject matter. It must contain an IPR (default value is "IPTC"), an 8 digit Subject Reference Number and an optional Subject Name, Subject Matter Name and Subject Detail Name. Each part of the Subject reference is separated by a colon (:). The Subject Reference Number contains three parts, a 2 digit Subject Number, a 3 digit Subject Matter Number and a 3 digit Subject Detail Number thus providing unique identification of the object's subject.

enum.name: SubjectReferenceNumbers
enum.desc: Subject Reference Number and Subject Name relationship (version IPTC/1)

item.name: ArtsCultureEntertainment
item.desc: Matters pertaining to the advancement and refinement of the human mind, of interests, skills, tastes and emotions

item.name: CrimeLawJustice
item.desc: Establishment and/or statement of the rules of behaviour in society, the enforcement of these rules, breaches of the rules and the punishment of offenders. Organisations and bodies involved in these activities.

item.name: DisastersAccidents
item.desc: Man made and natural events resulting in loss of life or injury to living creatures and/or damage to inanimate objects or property.

item.name: EconomyBusinessFinance
item.desc: All matters concerning the planning, production and exchange of wealth.

item.name: Education
item.desc: All aspects of furthering knowledge of human individuals from birth to death.

item.name: EnvironmentalIssues
item.desc: All aspects of protection, damage, and condition of the ecosystem of the planet earth and its surroundings.

item.name: Health
item.desc: All aspects pertaining to the physical and mental welfare of human beings.

item.name: HumanInterest
item.desc: Lighter items about individuals, groups, animals or objects.

item.name: Labour
item.desc: Social aspects, organisations, rules and conditions affecting the employment of human effort for the generation of wealth or provision of services and the economic support of the unemployed.

item.name: LifestyleAndLeisure
item.desc: Activities undertaken for pleasure, relaxation or recreation outside paid employment, including eating and travel.

item.name: Politics
item.desc: Local, regional, national and international exercise of power, or struggle for power, and the relationships between governing bodies and states.

item.name: ReligionBelief
item.desc: All aspects of human existence involving theology, philosophy, ethics and spirituality.

item.name: ScienceTechnology
item.desc: All aspects pertaining to human understanding of nature and the physical world and the development and application of this knowledge

item.name: SocialIssues
item.desc: Aspects of the behaviour of humans affecting the quality of life.

item.name: Sport
item.desc: Competitive exercise involving physical effort. Organisations and bodies involved in these activities.

item.name: UnrestConflictsWar
item.desc: Acts of socially or politically motivated protest and/or violence.

item.name: Weather
item.desc: The study, reporting and predic meteorological phenomena.

enum.name: SubjectMatterMembers
enum.desc: Subject Matter Name and Subject Reference Number relationship

enum.name: EconomySubjectDetail
enum.desc: Subject Detail Name and Subject Refrence Number relationship (Economy, Business & Finnance)
